page.title: 14COASTAL FOOTPATH WILDLIFE
page.content:
There is quite a{lot of wildlife}in the area possibly because there are {few people}living here as much of the land belongs to Gulf Oil Refinery. When I walked the footpath I found an abundance of occupied{badger setts and{fox dens. As usual a lot of the wild flowers were{Ragwort}(poisonous to animals), although I saw a fair number of quite rare flowers like{harebells}and{sea {pinks. } The main excitement came when suddenly I spotted a{peregrine falcon hovering overhead, the{black-backed {sea-gulls}were quite unconcerned. After that I returned to the main task - picking the{blackberries}for our tea!
by Elizabeth Edgington
